text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to provide an explanation of the aims of a foreign trade contract, specifically outlining the rights and obligations of each party. The candidate answer provides an extremely detailed checklist of clauses that *should be in* the contract, and a plain-English guide explaining *why* each clause matters (e.g., defining territory, setting performance targets). While this implicitly covers rights and obligations, it does not explicitly state the fundamental *aim* of the contract as being the delineation of rights and obligations. It jumps straight into the specifics rather than stating the overarching purpose first.", "criterion_id": "b42c8eae-afb3-48f6-a41d-ce406914b9d1"}
